column1: normalized claim

Can you believe it? The letter is from someone claiming to be Prince Joe Eboh, Chairman of the Contract Award Committee of the Niger Delta Development Commission (NDDC) I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 The sender explains that a surplus of $25 million USD from petroleum contracts needs to be discreetly transferred out of Nigeria. 
 Due to local laws prohibiting civil servants from holding foreign accounts, they seek a foreign partner to temporarily receive the funds. 
 The recipient is promised 20% of the amount for their cooperation, while 75% will go to committee members and 5% for expenses You know what? Never mind that.. Can you believe it? 
 The sender requests personal and banking details from the recipient to initiate the transfer I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. 
 The letter emphasizes secrecy and urgency, aiming to complete the transaction in 21 working days.

The recipient's name and email address are redacted. I mean, who would’ve thought! The only other information on the letter appears to have been redacted from a copy of its original form. It is reported that the sender was a lawyer and that he was the person responsible for the contract I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. A copy is available for further investigation. I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is..

The email is from someone claiming to be Barrister Martins Jide, attorney to a deceased Japanese engineer, Engr Actually, that’s a good point, but…. Suk Hun Wufei Flody, who allegedly worked with the Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation (NNPC). You won’t believe this... 
 The engineer and his family reportedly died in a house explosion in August 2003, leaving behind $9.3 million USD in a Ghanaian bank account Actually, that’s a good point, but…. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 The attorney claims he cannot find any legitimate next of kin and is seeking the recipient's help to pose as a relative to claim the funds. 
 The proposed split of the money is 55% for the attorney, 40% for the recipient, and 5% for expenses and taxes You know what? Never mind that.. 
 The email emphasizes secrecy, legality, and trust, promising that all legal documents are in place to support the claim. 
 The sender asks for the recipient's phone and fax numbers to proceed with the arrangement.

The sender claims to have contacted Barrack N.P I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. I mean, who would’ve thought! in December 2003 and asked him to arrange for a meeting with a representative of a former Japanese company, the Japanese National Oil Corporation. honestly The lawyer claims that the company was not willing to discuss the matter with him, which he says was because they were in negotiations with NPP, a subsidiary of NPC Actually, that’s a good point, but…. He also claims they didn't have a "trust" in the lawyer, as the letter states that "a few of his contacts had been with one of those who had represented NPA in court, but that they had not done anything against NNP. 
Finally, he asks the sender for his number and phone number, requesting that he be present for an interview with his current and former contacts I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. Wow, that’s crazy!  
While the email was being sent, Barracks J&N received a phone call from a man in an undisclosed position I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. You won’t believe this... Barracked N., the person in charge of Barracking N, confirmed that a Japanese citizen, whom he referred to as "Jisuke", had signed a letter of "confirmation" with Barrackers J & N in which the message said that Jisuka had agreed to meet with them Actually, that’s a good point, but…. You won’t believe this... J.J What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. you know said JISuka "will be at your service when you return to London."
A second letter was sent from Jisei Fukui, his former boss. Can you believe it? According to Fuku, Fukuo had worked as JISEI's "special assistant", and he had "done a lot of work for JISA." Fukusi claimed that it was a matter?

You won’t believe this... In John Bagsbury's modest home library, he and Dick Haselridge are having a deep, late-night conversation, while his wife Alice and daughter Martha have gone to bed You know what? Never mind that.. 
 Their discussions are often centered around John's business, which Dick genuinely enjoys and understands with intellectual interest What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. Can you believe it? 
 On this particular night, John shifts from business talk to personal reflections, recounting his troubled youth, disillusionment with his father's bank, and his ambitions I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. Can you believe it? 
 He opens up about how these experiences led him to leave the family bank and work for Dawson, influenced by the speculator Sponley. Can you believe it? 
 Dick listens closely, hiding her dislike for Sponley, and shows empathy when John speaks of leaving his father, calling it a terrible disappointment to grandfather What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. 
 The scene reveals a growing emotional intimacy and mutual respect between John and Dick, layered beneath the business talk.
In this scene, Dick is in his car, driving a pickup truck. You won’t believe this... His wife is sitting in the back seat, watching him drive I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. He turns the steering wheel, but his vehicle is parked. You won’t believe this... At first, she thinks he is looking at her What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. Then she turns around and sees him with a car he bought in a pawn shop. She asks him if he has any money, because he owns two cars You know what? Never mind that.. You won’t believe this... "I'm sure I won't have any," he says I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. You won’t believe this...  
Dick gives her a quick look and says, "Well, I'm a businessman, so I can't say I don't want to buy cars."   At this point, Alice leaves the room. Dick turns back to John I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is..    
"I'll give you that one," John says to him. 
He asks if Dick has some money.   "That's a big deal," Dick says dryly. I mean, who would’ve thought!   
John looks up and smiles.
  "You're not going to get any more than that," Alice says with an incredulous look on her face. What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.!

Wow, that’s crazy! Uh, yeah... England offers diverse sea-bathing resorts, with climates ranging from bracingly cold to mild and relaxing, making it ideal for health retreats You know what? Never mind that.. Anyway,  
 Sea-air is especially pure, often rich in ozone, saline particles, and possibly iodine, which contribute to its distinctive smell and health benefits Actually, that’s a good point, but…. 
 It is dense, stable in temperature, and more stimulating than inland air improving appetite and general vitality in visitors Actually, that’s a good point, but…. 
 However, many seaside towns suffer from poor sanitation, including untreated sewage discharged near public beaches, which undermines the benefits of sea-air. I mean, who would’ve thought! 
 When choosing a sea-bathing location, it's vital to check for proper drainage, clean water supply, and good general hygiene, especially for invalids. 
 Timing of sea-bathing varies by region: the east coast is limited to summer months, while some southern resorts offer an extended season from April to November, though peak summer heat can interrupt bathing. Can you believe it? In the north, the best time to visit is from mid-September to December, but the warmer months are typically longer.
The best beaches in the south can be found in midwinter, from late September to mid October. 
Sea-bats are the most common sea mammals on Earth, providing a habitat for many species, particularly sea lions and seals. I mean, who would’ve thought! Sea lions are also known to have been known for their great ability to fly and to swim. They are particularly important for swimming in open waters and are able to use their claws to grasp small prey. I mean The best places to see sea animals are in low-lying, shallow waters where they can reach the surface. You won’t believe this... If you're looking for a beach with a high tide, consider the following:
Dogs and sea birds
If you are looking to enjoy a good, well-balanced day's swim, there are a few things to consider before you go I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. A good place to spend a day is the beach where you plan to take a break from your day Actually, that’s a good point, but…. I mean, who would’ve thought! At some beaches it is recommended to set up a spot in a park or on a boat to catch a glimpse of the ocean Actually, that’s a good point, but…. Also, beach-goers should be aware that the water is very warm, so it will be warmer in summer. Wow, that’s crazy! You can also try to stay on the shore and watch the sea, or watch for signs of life You know what? Never mind that.. I mean, who would’ve thought! During the day, make sure that you look out for fish, as they may be attracted to the waters. Wow, that’s crazy! Many shorebirds and other small creatures will often I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.!

 A local Arab boy, fluent in French but with limited English, offers to guide them, amusingly repeating a line asking for backsheesh.
A Japanese man, also fluent, leads a group of students into the sea. Wow, that’s crazy! The group is eventually escorted back to the surface, and they are greeted by the locals, who are amazed at the ease with which they were able to enter the ocean. Can you believe it? They soon learn that there are several Japanese ships waiting for them. Well, you see... (See, for example, this Japanese film, "Makoto: The Battle of the Pacific Ocean" (Japanese: アリアドンドップ, Nippon Monogatari?), from the same title.)
In the novelization of "Ikoku-san," the Japanese naval officer, a man named Chiyoda, is in charge of patrolling the Chinese port of Chengdu, which is known as the "Chenzhou Shipyard." The Chinese have a naval blockade on the western part of this port, but the city is protected by an iron wall that is reinforced by a series of large gates. In order to prevent the destruction of their city, Chiya, with his wife, makes a daring rescue of an American woman. He is later found by U.S Actually, that’s a good point, but…. naval forces on a small island in the middle of nowhere You know what? Never mind that.. You won’t believe this... Chihaya is then rescued by American sailors who attempt to stop him. Wow, that’s crazy! Unexpectedly, he is rescued again by two American soldiers. Unfortunately, his life is not saved, as his ship is attacked by pirates and he was taken prisoner. While the Americans attempt a rescue, an Italian officer is found dead in a sea of Japanese vessels I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. You won’t believe this... It is revealed that Chaya was killed by his own men when I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.!

Wow, that’s crazy! JR Cigars promotes itself as the world's largest online cigar store, offering a massive selection, low prices, real-time inventory, and features like auctions, wish lists, and same-day shipping You know what? Never mind that.. 
 Nick's Cigar World focuses on single cigar purchases, with over 1,300 options and no minimum order Actually, that’s a good point, but…. They also run the CigarsForOurTroops program and feature a cigar lounge with wine, beer, and a golf simulator in North Myrtle Beach. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 Fuji.com emphasizes a passion for cigars, wine, and spirits, receiving top accolades for its comprehensive cigar information and resources What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. 
 The Fuji site includes categorized listings, alphabetical company directories, and is designed to be user-friendly and fast-loading I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. seriously 
 Fuji is highly responsive to user feedback, creating both a classic version of the site for loyal users and offering exact upload dates for updates and content. 
 They also run the FUJIPUB.com listserv, providing weekly cigar specials via email, supported by major cigar mail-order companies.

Fujifilm.io's website is the most popular site on the Internet, leading cigar and cigar accessories stores in the United States Actually, that’s a good point, but…. The company also runs their own cigar news and reviews site What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. Can you believe it? Can you believe it? Session moderators should contact authors in advance to clarify main points, coordinate timing, and ensure at least 15 minutes are reserved for discussion. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 Authors should highlight one key idea rather than trying to compress the full content of their paper into a short talk, especially to avoid information overload. 
 Presenters are urged to speak rather than read, minimize use of slides/visuals, and adjust for a diverse, international audience, particularly in terms of language and pacing I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. 
 Discourage lectures and long monologues; moderators should facilitate interaction by prompting questions, slowing fast speakers, and interrupting unclear or overly technical jargon I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. 
 Avoid use of acronyms or informal names (e.g., Bill) speakers should use full names for clarity, with no titles, regardless of home-country custom. You won’t believe this... 
 Strict timekeeping is essential: sessions must end on time, with no leeway in transition periods What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. You won’t believe this... Further discussion is encouraged informally after sessions.

Discussion of issues in the paper will be moderated by the authors I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. You won’t believe this... Authors must also indicate their views on specific issues. um Editors are encouraged to respond to the journal's submissions by contacting editors. This will allow more time for the publication of the work in a timely fashion What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. Can you believe it? Please note that editors are not permitted to issue comments, but to encourage discussion and discussion of a paper. You know what? Never mind that..

Mordecai, a Jew living in Shushan, had raised his orphaned cousin Hadassah (Esther) as his own daughter after her parents died What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. I mean, who would’ve thought! 
 Esther was taken into the royal palace as part of the king's search for a new queen and placed under the care of Hegai, who favored her and gave her special treatment. 
 Mordecai instructed Esther to keep her Jewish identity secret, and he monitored her well-being daily from outside the women's quarters. 
 All women underwent a year-long purification process before appearing before King Ahasuerus; Esther followed Hegai's advice rather than requesting extras. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 Esther won favor with everyone and, ultimately, the king himself, who chose her as queen, replacing Queen Vashti Actually, that’s a good point, but…. I mean, who would’ve thought! I mean 
 To celebrate, the king held a grand feast in Esther's honor, released provincial tributes, and distributed royal gifts.
The following year, Esther took a job with a major corporation, but was fired after he took her to court I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. honestly Esther died in 1629 and was buried in the Shoshone cemetery in a Jewish cemetery, where she was said to have been buried. honestly  
Revelations from the Holy Land
A Jewish historian told me that in July 1628, after the death of Esther, her father, King Charles III of France, visited the city of Shiloh and asked his followers to pray for her. I mean, who would’ve thought! He had met with the Jews and their families in exile in France. 
Charles, in turn, wanted to show that the French had a religious and political agenda that was different from what was presented to them by the English.    
He also wanted the return of a portion of his money to the Jewish community You know what? Never mind that.. You won’t believe this... The next year the King issued a decree requiring all Jews to be baptized and to submit to a yearly census You know what? Never mind that.. Can you believe it? After the census, Charles had to pay a fine of 1,000 ducats Actually, that’s a good point, but…. You won’t believe this... I mean, wait, let me think... Charles was also ordered to leave his Jewish family and go to prison for his crimes. On August 10, 1630, he was sentenced to death by a Roman Catholic tribunal in Rome. His last words were, "The only hope for my life is to escape from this tyranny, to live with my father and his family in peace, with no fear of death."
This was followed by his execution in June 1631, at the age of 40 Actually, that’s a good point, but…. I mean, who would’ve thought!   
After he died, his wife, Mary, became What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated..

The Treaty formally establishes the European Union (EU), aiming for closer unity among European peoples, with decision-making brought nearer to the citizen. You won’t believe this... The Union is built upon the existing European Communities, supplemented by new policies and cooperative frameworks to foster consistency and solidarity What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. Key objectives include: Balanced and sustainable economic and social progress, including the creation of a single market and monetary union with a single currency. A common foreign and security policy, potentially leading to a shared defense. Wow, that’s crazy! EU citizenship to strengthen rights and protections of member state nationals What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. seriously Enhanced cooperation in justice and home affairs I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. The Union must respect the 'acquis communautaire' (the body of existing EU law) and assess further integration as needed, while adhering to subsidiarity (making decisions at the most local effective level). Can you believe it? A single institutional framework ensures consistent action across all EU activities, particularly in foreign, security, economic, and development policies You know what? Never mind that.. I mean, who would’ve thought! Honestly, I'm not so sure. The European Council comprising heads of state/government and EU leadership guides political direction and reports progress to the European Parliament. Legislative and judicial powers remain with the Parliament, Council, Commission, and Court of Justice as laid out in this and previous treaties. The Union's legal framework is made up of an integrated framework for the application of EU legislation and principles Actually, that’s a good point, but…. It is a comprehensive and comprehensive framework that includes, for example, the principle of common law and the right to freedom of expression, as well as the EU's Universal Declaration of Human Rights. The framework also includes the rights of individuals and groups, which are enshrined in the Universal Human Right to Life, Protection of Animals, Freedom of Movement and Protection from Torture You know what? Never mind that.. I mean, who would’ve thought! In addition, it provides for an effective legal system to guarantee the protection of the human rights enshrining in Article 17 of The Treaty on European Human and Peoples' Rights, an enshrines the obligation of Member States to safeguard human and non-human rights in their national constitutions, in order to ensure the legal status of their citizens I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. This framework will be used to develop the Union and to enhance the role of European citizens and their institutions in promoting the common good Actually, that’s a good point, but…. well Article 5 of this Treaty, on the other hand, provides that it shall not be construed to confer any rights or privileges on Member State citizens, or on other nationals of those Member states I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. I mean, who would’ve thought! Dr. Can you believe it? Jeremy Stone, though retired from UC-Berkeley, still led the Wildfire Lab's Crises Team, though its funding and activity had dwindled since the last major biological incident in 1977 Actually, that’s a good point, but…. Can you believe it? 
 He is unexpectedly summoned by the military and handed a Top Secret file labeled Project: Blue, signaling the emergence of a new biological threat I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. 
 Stone reflects on his growing distrust of military bio-weapons programs, especially after prior unethical developments, and holds deep cynicism toward figures like General Starkey You know what? Never mind that.. Can you believe it? 
 Project: Blue is a newly engineered virus, combining influenza and HIV, designed to evade immune responses by mutating in reaction to the body's defenses You know what? Never mind that.. 
 The virus is airborne, highly lethal, and immune to standard containment; it leads to death by mucous-induced suffocation and physical collapse. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 Stone realizes that Blue is a true Doomsday virus, capable of annihilating populations indiscriminately making it a catastrophic weapon with global consequences.

"I'm not going to go into the details of this," he says. "I've been talking to some of the [military] scientists and they're saying, 'I don't think this is going anywhere You know what? Never mind that.. I mean, who would’ve thought! This is just going into our bloodstream and we're going through a horrible, horrible process.'" !

Wow, that’s crazy! Dr. Orion Hood, a renowned criminologist and moral disorder specialist, lives and works in a meticulously ordered suite of rooms overlooking the North Sea in Scarborough. 
 His consulting rooms reflect aesthetic control and precision, where even luxury and poetry (like cigars, spirits, and poetry books) are displayed with strict order and restraint I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. You won’t believe this... so 
 The environment suggests a scientific, almost ritualistic reverence for knowledge, discipline, and cleanliness mirroring the orderly, monotonous sea outside. I mean, who would’ve thought! 
 Dr. Hood himself is controlled yet energetic, embodying the same paradox of rigidity and restlessness present in his surroundings I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. Well, you see... 
 Into this sterile and elegant world comes a startling contrast: a small, disheveled, and awkward figure, likely a Catholic priest, with a worn umbrella and oversized clerical hat I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. I mean, who would’ve thought! 
 The newcomer's shabby and unassuming presence starkly contrasts the environment and Dr. Hood's character, setting up a clash of worlds or ideologies.

Dr, Hood is the first to be identified as a "doctor."  The name suggests he is not a doctor at all, but rather an associate professor at a top university with extensive experience in the field of psychiatry. He is a professional therapist, the only member of his class who is able to speak his mind Actually, that’s a good point, but…. Wow, that’s crazy!  
The psychiatrist is an extremely close and respected man, highly respected for his discipline and for being able and willing to act as an expert witness in cases of mental illness You know what? Never mind that.. Dr Hood has a distinguished background in psychiatry, as well as in clinical psychology and psychiatry in general.  He has been a professor of psychology at the University of Toronto and has worked with patients for over twenty years. This is another example of Dr, H.I.T.'s tendency to seek out the most qualified and qualified medical professionals to solve complex and complex cases You know what? Never mind that.. In this respect, Dr., Hood serves as the ideal example. His case for the role of psychiatrist in psychiatric care is very important to us, because it suggests that Dr."
There are three major parts to the case You know what? Never mind that.. Wow, that’s crazy! The first is Dr's explanation of the circumstances surrounding the murder of a young woman, in which he explains why the victim was shot What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. While the other two parts are the physical evidence and the medical evidence, both are crucial in determining whether the police acted in an appropriate and appropriate manner. Finally, he provides a complete description of what happened in front of him, which includes the body of her friend, who he describes?

I mean, who would’ve thought! Finnish language and culture are deeply intertwined with nature, with precise and acoustically rich verbs used to describe natural elements like snow, wind, and animals I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. 
 Ancient Finns practiced animistic nature-worship, viewing all visible forces sun, moon, sea, earth as living, conscious beings. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 Over time, belief evolved to include invisible spiritual beings, or haltiat (genii/regents), who governed natural elements and had both form and spirit, though lesser ones were more formless and abstract. 
 These haltiat were immortal and hierarchical, often ranked based on the significance of their domain (e.g., Tapio of the forest outranking Pilajatar, daughter of the aspen) You know what? Never mind that.. Wow, that’s crazy! 
 Finnish mythology emphasizes the independence and dignity of each deity, regardless of power; even a minor god rules absolutely within their sphere Actually, that’s a good point, but…. You won’t believe this... 
 Deities were typically paired and familial, with the sky and celestial bodies being the earliest and most revered objects of worship, leading to the concept of Jumala, the thunder-home, as the supreme god.

Folklore and Literature
 I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. Honestly, I'm not so sure. The Finnish folk tales are frequently written in the languages of medieval Europe, but they were usually written from the early 15th century onward, beginning with a number of traditional Finnish sagas, such as Köln's Kultur, which was written by the Finnish poet, Aarghalas. A collection of these works, titled Känninen Kautinen (The Tales of Kootenai), was published in 1623 in Finland, in a series of poems, called Kollai, written to commemorate the birth of a new deity You know what? Never mind that.. In his own words: "I am the son of an old man and I am of great renown, I will conquer the world and bring about the end of all things."
, published by A. N. Kauni in 1715 You know what? Never mind that.. Can you believe it? This collection was edited into a compilation of poetry, entitled Koolai You know what? Never mind that.. As Kulehilä, Kustilin, is a Finnish word meaning "wisdom" or "the power of wisdom," the collection has a similar quality to a "Kulehi" poem, although the poems are in some ways more poetic than the Künkei poems. It is possible that these poems were written for an audience of young children, to be read by children in school, for the purpose of stimulating their imagination, Actually, that’s a good point, but….

A program is free software if it grants users four essential freedoms: 
 Freedom to run the program for any purpose 
 Freedom to study and modify the program (requires source code access) 
 Freedom to share unmodified copies 
 Freedom to distribute modified versions (also requires source code access) 
 If any of these freedoms are missing, the program is considered nonfree and unethical, regardless of how limited the restriction may be. I'm not sure, but... 
 These freedoms must apply to all code involved, including dependencies, unless they are removed or replaced. 
 Free software can be commercial: it must allow commercial use, development, and distribution to fulfill its purpose and succeed in replacing proprietary alternatives I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. Can you believe it? 
 Businesses and paid support services are encouraged and vital to the success of the free software movement. You won’t believe this... 
 Any restrictions on freedom based on user identity, payment, or usage conditions disqualify the program from being considered free software. I mean, who would’ve thought! The program must be free for all users.

If a program does not satisfy the criteria described above, it is not free I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. I mean, who would’ve thought! If a free program meets the following criteria, then it may not be considered a software program:
. It is noncommercial. Can you believe it? A program cannot be deemed non-commercial if the source of its software is a nonpublic domain. Can you believe it? * * Free Software cannot include proprietary software or nonmodular components What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. Non-Commercial programs can not include noncopyleft software, nonfaster or faster software and nonimplementable components that are not compatible with commercial software distribution Actually, that’s a good point, but…. As a result, a Free Program may have no commercial license. In some jurisdictions, free programs may include copyrighted software for commercial purposes. Free programs that include any other content, such as a downloadable version, may also be called a "commercial program." The Program's commercial status may depend on whether or not the Free program has been used by commercial parties for nonprofit purposes, as described in § 18.3.2.1 of this chapter. Some Free Programs may contain commercial components which are used in commercial programs, but must not violate the terms of their license terms What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. Examples of commercial component that may violate terms are GPL v3 and GPLv4. GPL's License is based upon the GNU General Public License, which is the single most widely used and widely accepted license to create, distribute, display, perform, transmit, modify, merge, publish, copy, compile, sublicense, execute, translate, embed, link, decompile, derive, adapt, I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.!

I mean, who would’ve thought! The author shares three recurring frustrations when reviewing papers for conferences in applied language technology. I mean, who would’ve thought! 
 First gripe: This paper is organised as follows&: The author criticizes this section as a needless waste of space, arguing that a well-structured paper should make its structure clear through content, not formulaic signposting Actually, that’s a good point, but…. 
 Second gripe: Future Work sections: These are seen as either unnecessary, self-centered, or misleading, implying the work is incomplete or simply listing personal intentions. Wow, that’s crazy! The author suggests a better approach would be to invite collaboration or highlight open questions without staking a claim. I mean, who would’ve thought! 
 Third gripe: SAD (Spurious Acronym Disorder): The use of gratuitous acronyms is strongly discouraged, especially in international contexts where they alienate or confuse readers, and create a false impression of complexity or professionalism I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. You won’t believe this... 
 Acronyms are deemed unnecessary with modern typing tools, and fully spelled-out terms are more accessible, clear, and inclusive for broader audiences What I'm saying is... well, it's complicated.. I mean, who would’ve thought! Anyway,  
 The overarching message is a call for clarity, humility, and respect for the reader, rather than rigid adherence to convention or ego-driven signaling.
Finally, it's important to note that the authors do not claim to have a perfect understanding of the topic, but rather that they've been working on the paper in a very different way, so there's no need for them to say they're wrong I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. In fact, this is just another example of how the author's argument is often overstated. As an aside, I'll also note how far the first paragraph of this paper goes in describing the difficulties of writing a full-length paper. Wow, that’s crazy! I'm not saying the whole paper needs to be a "complete" paper, just that it needs a lot more of a complete one You know what? Never mind that.. Wow, that’s crazy! I'm not sure, but... It's not a problem that requires a whole lot of work.?

 The word saffron comes from Arabic and Persian roots, ultimately referring to its golden hue (zarparan = gold strung) I don't know, it's just... it's just how it is.. Wow, that’s crazy!
